results.title: Setting the scene: the Metropolis case
results.brief_description: A limited edition DVD presented exclusively to visitors of the ‘Setting the Scene’ exhibition at the Australian Centre of the Moving Image, Federation Square, Melbourne. featuring ‘The Metropolis case’ and special bonus material (‘The Restoration’ and ‘Photo Gallery’).
results.description: A limited edition DVD presented exclusively to visitors of the ‘Setting the Scene’ exhibition at the Australian Centre of the Moving Image, Federation Square, Melbourne. featuring ‘The Metropolis case’ and special bonus material (‘The Restoration’ and ‘Photo Gallery’).

results.title: Zero [DVD] (D)
results.brief_description: This is the debut feature of surrealist avant-garde filmmaker James Fotopoulos. A work that oscillates between scenes of serenity and ones of utter depravity, “Zero” tells the story of a man (Matthew Buckley) sliding into absolute isolation, accompanied by pornography, mental illness and disease. In his drab apartment, with its exposed pipes and austere furnishings, the man has pasted explicit pornographic and medical images. He also has collected an array of jars that hold specimens of tumours and animals. The man seeks intimacy and release from his seclusion but his only source of contact is his extensive collection of pornographic magazines that he pours over and speaks to in an array of demonic monologues, whilst a gruesome cyst grows on his forearm. The man’s masturbatory fantasies lead to him romancing the armless upper half of a store mannequin whom he covets. In alternate sequences the man is witnessed strolling through fields and forests, having found a space (perhaps imaginary) in which to reside free from the conflict and poisonous, misogynist, racist ranting of his mind. Fotopoulos’ experimental, minimalist cinema despondently explores the spaces of physical desire and the dark parameters of loneliness. The industrial sound-scape, that marks all of this Midwestern filmmaker’s work, adds to the sense of futility and misanthropy that permeates the unilateral narrative. Music by Tom Nicholl. Features images of pornography and excessive female nudity and medical experimentation. Warning: some scenes may disturb.

results.title: Setting the scene: landscape spaces (Chris Kennedy and Stephen Curtis)
results.brief_description: Interviews with Chris Kennedy and Stephen Curtis, Australian production designers on their work. Chris Kennedy talks about the two different approaches he took for two films, the building of a town in The Proposition and finding already existing locations for The Road. Stephen Curtis talks about his approach to production designing on his work on Bedevil and Night Cries. Prodcued by AFTRS and ACMI for ACMI’s Setting the Scene exhibition.

results.title: Bunga our haven
results.creator_credit: Pam Enting, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Pam Enting and some 19 other families are part owners of what they call ‘Bunga Haven’. She tells the story of how this arrangement came to be, and of the environmental battles that were undertaken to save the lake.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pam Enting, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Travelling divorcees
results.creator_credit: Michelle Rayner, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Michelle Rayner reflects on the evolution of the marriage between Patricia and Michael, her parents. Throughout the years they have gone through many changes both personally and as a couple, and often reflecting the times.

results.title: Whatever happened to La Pérouse?
results.creator_credit: Peter Kiernan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In addition to being a cherished family home, La Pérouse in Heidelberg, Victoria, is a historic building with a rich history, full of opera singers, vaudeville stars, and driving lessons.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Kiernan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Our Matt
results.creator_credit: Noel Withers, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Noel Withers is very proud of his son Matt. Born with Crouzon Syndrome, Matt suffered hearing loss, facial abnomalities and had to undergo numerous procedures to accommodate brain growth. Some operations were more successful than others, but Matt faced them all with a determination that inspired admiration in those around him.

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (September 2008)
results.brief_description: Eight members of the general public in Melbourne create stories about the things the resonate strongly with them, whether that is the sense of home, the love of family or cherished memories.
